title.narrative: South Sudan Trust Fund for Reconciliation, Stabilization, and Resilience
Sydsudan Trust Fund for Reconciliation, Stabilization, and Resilience (RSRTF)

description.narrative:
Huvudsyftet med RSRTF är att stödja mer resiliensinriktad programmering genom att rikta stödet till utvalda områden där förutsättningarna för att främja de miljöer som är nödvändiga för att möjliggöra det långsiktiga engagemang som krävs för att uppnå långsiktiga utvecklingsmål. Insatsen syftar till ökad finansiering och ökat engagemang i politiska, freds- och säkerhetsfrågor där finansieringen har begränsats, liksom att överbrygga fredsbevarande och säkerhets-, humanitära och utvecklingsinsatser. .
Fondens mål är 1) Stödåtgärder som bidrar till säkrare miljöer 2) Uppmuntra strategisk och gemensam programmering för att överbrygga fredsbevarande och säkerhets- och utvecklingsinsatser och 3) Främja hållbara, lokalt ledda, kontextspecifika och oevidensbaseradeinitiativ på lokal nivå.
Fonden kommer att stödja strategiska insatser som analyserar konfliktdynamiken ur ett holistiskt perspektiv och som fokuserar på lokalt anpassade lösningar för att ta itu med eller minska orsakerna till politiska, säkerhets-, sociala eller ekonomiska sårbarheter. Fonden kommer att anta en områdesbaserad programmeringsmetod som riktar sig till specifika områden där möjligheter finns att leverera förändring och bryta sig ur konflikter, våld och givarberoende. Fonden kommer att spela en effektiv roll när det gäller att främja starkare lokalt fokus på hur resurserna fördelas och säkerställa lokalt förankrad analys som återspeglar områdets unika karaktär och lokala konfliktaktörer. För varje strategiskt område som identifieras av fonden så kommer en områdesreferensgrupp (ARG) att sammankallas för att genomföra en detaljerad analys av lokala konflikter, samt lokal politisk- och säkerhetsdynamik. ARG kommer att identifiera befintliga resurser, inklusive erfarenheter och reflektioner såsom lokala traditioner, praxis och kapacitet för fred. Tillsammans kommer ARG att identifiera kollektiva projektinterventioner som tar itu med viktiga drivkrafter för instabilitet och samhällsupplösning och stödjande samhällen för att uppnå de långsiktiga vinsterna av bestående fred.

The main objective of the RSRTF is to support the drive towards more resilience focused programming by fostering stable political and security environments necessary to enable the sustained engagements required to achieve long-term recovery and development goals. This trough providing funding for increased engagement on political, peace and security issues where the funding has been limited as well as by bridging peacekeeping and security, humanitarian, and long-term recovery and development efforts.
The objectives of the fund include 1) Support actions that contribute to stable political and security environments; 2) Encourage strategic and joint programming to bridge peacekeeping and security, recovery and development efforts; and 3) Promote sustainable locally-led, context specific and evidence-based action.
The Fund will support strategic interventions that appraise conflict dynamics holistically and apply appropriate solutions to address or diminish root causes whether political, security, social, or economic. The Fund will adopt an area-based programming approach, targeting distinct locations where opportunities exist to deliver transformational change and move beyond cycles of conflict, violence and aid dependency. The Fund will play an effective role in promoting stronger local focus in the way resources are programmed and ensure locally led analysis reflective of the unique nature of the area and the local drivers of conflict. For each strategic area identified by the Fund Steering Committee, an Area Reference Group will be convened to conduct detailed analysis of localized conflict, political and security dynamics. The ARG will identify existing resources, including lessons and reflections on indigenous traditions, practices and capacities for peace. Together the ARG will identify collective project interventions that tackle key drivers of instability and societal disintegration and support communities to realize the long-term gains of sustained peace.

The South Sudan RSRTF will adopt an area-based programming approach, targeting distinct geographic locations where opportunities exist to deliver transformational change and move beyond cycles of conflict and violence. While focusing on conflict resolution and peacebuilding at the community level, the geographic selection will consider multi-level conflict analysis, recognizing linkages between local and national dynamics so that engagement can also be targeted to address more strategic grievances that influence broader progress towards a national peace. The objectives of the fund include 1) Support actions that contribute to stable political and security environments; 2) Encourage strategic and joint programming to bridge peacekeeping and security, recovery and development efforts; and 3) Promote sustainable locally-led, context specific and evidence-based action. The South Sudan RSRTF will work to build conditions of peace and stability conducive for enabling viable resilience endeavors. The fund aims to improve the way capability from across development, humanitarian and peacebuilding entities is brought together, providing strategic financing to integrated programmes that together lessen the destructive drivers of conflict and develop more peaceful and, ultimately, self-reliant communities. The area-based programming approach builds in locally led comprehensive political, security and situation analysis. The intent is to draw on existing knowledge and expertise, working through existinglocal partners and with communities to pursue real opportunities for transformational change - to move beyond the recurrent cycles of conflict and violence. The approach will reinforce sustainable and inclusive, community driven programming building on existing resources including lessons and reflections on local practices and capacities for peace. The South Sudan RSRTF will provide strategic financing to area based programmes that bring together UN agencies, the Mission and NGOs to deliver local results that collectively lessen the destructive drivers of conflict and contribute to more self-reliant and peaceful communities. Drawing on the comparative advantages across a variety of organizations, the Trust Fund will engage strategically with peacebuilding, stabilization and resilience actors to tailor interventions that can bring together the mutually-reinforcing elements. It is not envisaged that the Fund will meet all requirements for any given area. However, as a strategic entry-point it can create the conditions for subsequent programming as well as facilitating the piloting of activities to strengthen the evidence base and foster the development of best practices. In this regard activities initially supported by the Trust Fund are likely to be catalytic in terms of laying the ground work for sustained, integrated programming efforts that over time will deliver the priorities and outcomes envisaged in the UNCF. As well as seeking to sustain multi-stakeholder area-based partnerships through direct financing, the Fund will additionally encourage initiatives that build synergies with other complimentary stabilization and resilience funds and programmes including the Partnership for Recovery and Resilience (PfRR) and United Nations Peacebuilding Funded activities. The Fund will also promote collaboration where existing resources and expertise are available through initiatives such as the Conflict Sensitivity Resource Facility (CSRF) and Health and Education Pooled Funds.
